main event: A report from Omaha, Nebraska on May 13, 1954, documented a civilian sighting of a single round, fiery object that moved to the west and then disappeared behind trees.
interesting points: The object was described as large as a football and definitely aluminum in color.
It initially appeared to stand still at an angle of approximately 45 degrees before moving to the west and disappearing behind trees.
The witness reported seeing the object for approximately 2 minutes and observed it from a ground visual standpoint.
The reliability of the witness was considered clear, and there were no plausible explanations for the sighting.
The report indicates poor reliability of the witness reported.
